result.execSummary:
The defendant Efrain Garcia-Sotelo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).
  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the sum of $4,000.00 to Crime Victim's  Compensation Fund.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) Wis. stats and during Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay mandatory DNA surcharges, all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to Extended Supervision but remain a condition of Extended Supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 161 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain fulltime employment if appropriate.
Obtain high school diploma or GED. Vocational/educational training.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment and take medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with immediate family unless they ask the agent or institution in writing.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Random urine screens.  Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor;  and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for zero days.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO EACH COUNT OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended  Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 35 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 161 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 25 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 35 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 25 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  10 YEARS.  

Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Mental health assesment  and comply with recommended treatment and take medications.
*Random urine screens.
*Absolute sobriety. No drugs or alcohol
*No contact with immediate family unless they ask the agent or institution in writing.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment, if appropriate.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Anger Management.
*Pay restitution in the sum of $4000.00 to Crime Victim's Compensation Fund.
*Pay all costs and surcharges

As to each count: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharges AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to/ extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.  

Restitution is to be collected by the DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats. and during extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;

Defendant Efrain Garcia-Sotelo in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Efrain Garcia-Sotelo in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Grant Huebner.  
Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charges amended to:
Count 1: 1st Degree Reckless Homicide, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.02(1) 939.50(3)(b), a Class B Felony;
Count 2: 1st Degree Reckless Homicide, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.02(1) 939.50(3)(b), a Class B Felony.
Court Report submitted by defense, filed.

Defendant Efrain Garcia-Sotelo in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Efrain Garcia-Sotelo in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(4)(a), Wisconsin Statutes, copies of the doctor's report are forwarded to Assistant District Attorney Grant Huebner and to the defendant's Attorney, Bridget Krause.
Defendant does not challenge doctor's report.  Parties stipulate to doctor's report. Court finds defendant is competent to proceed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Efrain Garcia-Sotelo in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Efrain Garcia-Sotelo in custody.  Antoni Apollo for Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Arraignment scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
